item.title: Google Chrome disables uBlock Origin for some in Manifest v3 rollout
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google continues its rollout of gradually disabling uBlock Origin and other Manifest V2-based extensions in the Chrome web browser as part of its efforts to push users to Manifest V3-based extensions. [...]

item.title: SpyLend Android malware downloaded 100,000 times from Google Play
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An Android malware app called SpyLend has been downloaded over 100,000 times from Google Play, where it masqueraded as a financial tool but became a predatory loan app for those in India. [...]

item.title: Hacker steals record $1.46 billion from Bybit ETH cold wallet
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cryptocurrency exchange Bybit revealed today that an unknown attacker stole over $1.46 billion worth of cryptocurrency from one of its ETH cold wallets. [...]

item.title: CISA flags Craft CMS code injection flaw as exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) warns that a Craft CMS remote code execution flaw is being exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: Apple pulls iCloud end-to-end encryption feature in the UK
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Apple will no longer offer iCloud end-to-end encryption in the United Kingdom after the government requested a backdoor to access Apple customers' encrypted cloud data. [...]

item.title: Apiiro unveils free scanner to detect malicious code merges
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Security researchers at Apiiro have released two free, open-source tools designed to detect and block malicious code before they are added to software projects to curb supply chain attacks. [...]

item.title: Black Basta ransomware gang's internal chat logs leak online
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: An unknown leaker has released what they claim to be an archive of internal Matrix chat logs belonging to the Black Basta ransomware operation. [...]

item.title: US healthcare org pays $11M settlement over alleged cybersecurity lapses
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Health Net Federal Services (HNFS) and its parent company, Centene Corporation, have agreed to pay $11,253,400 to settle allegations that HNFS falsely certified compliance with cybersecurity requirements under its Defense Health Agency (DHA) TRICARE contract. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers use custom malware to spy on US telecom networks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Chinese state-sponsored Salt Typhoon hacking group uses a custom utility called JumbledPath to stealthily monitor network traffic and potentially capture sensitive data in cyberattacks on U.S. telecommunication providers. [...]

item.title: Integrating LLMs into security operations using Wazuh
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Wazuh
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) can provide many benefits to security professionals by helping them analyze logs, detect phishing attacks, or offering threat intelligence. Learn from Wazuh how to incorporate an LLM, like ChatGPT, into its open source security platform. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Power Pages zero-day bug exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft has issued a security bulletin for a high-severity elevation of privilege vulnerability in Power Pages, which hackers exploited as a zero-day in attacks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft testing fix for Windows 11 bug breaking SSH connections
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is now testing a fix for a longstanding known issue that is breaking SSH connections on some Windows 11 22H2 and 23H2 systems. [...]
